org.epics.ioc.pdrv
Interface Port

public interface Port

Interface for a port. If a method must be called with the port owned by the caller then it must be called either from a queueRequest callback or via the following pattern: 

     port.lockport(user)
     try {
         // calls to port and/or device
     } finally {
         port.unlock(user)
     }

Author:
mrk

Method Detail

report

java.lang.String report(boolean reportDevices,
                        int details)
Generate a report for this port. This should be called without owning the port. It can cause unnecessary delays if it is called with the port locked.

Parameters:
reportDevices - Also report all devices connected to the report.
details - How much to report.
Returns:
A String that is the report.

getDevices

Device[] getDevices()
Get an array of the port devices. This can be called without owning the port.

Returns:
The array of devices.

getTrace

Trace getTrace()
Get the Trace object for this port. This can be called without owning the port.

Returns:
The interface.

getDriverName

java.lang.String getDriverName()
Get the driverName. This can be called without owning the port.

Returns:
The name.

getPortName

java.lang.String getPortName()
Get the portName. This can be called without owning the port.

Returns:
The name.

canBlock

boolean canBlock()
Can this port block while performing I/O. This can be called without owning the port.

Returns:
(false,true) if it is (synchronous,asynchronous)

enable

void enable(boolean trueFalse)
Set the enable state. This can be called without owning the port.

Parameters:
trueFalse - The new state.

autoConnect

void autoConnect(boolean trueFalse)
Set the autoConnect state. This can be called without owning the port.

Parameters:
trueFalse - The new state.

getDevice

Device getDevice(User user,
                 java.lang.String deviceName)
Get the device for the specified deviceName. This can be called without owning the port. If a device deviceName does not exist than the portDriver is asked to create one.

Parameters:
user - The user.
deviceName - The name of the device.
Returns:
The Device interface or null if no device is available for the specified deviceName.

isConnected

boolean isConnected()
Is the port connected to hardware. This can be called without owning the port.

Returns:
(false,true) is it (is not, is connected)

isEnabled

boolean isEnabled()
Is the port enabled. This can be called without owning the port. If it is not enabled nothing will be taken from the queue and lockPort will fail.

Returns:
(false,true) if the port (is not, is) enabled,

isAutoConnect

boolean isAutoConnect()
Is autoConnect active. This can be called without owning the port. If it is than when the queue is scanned or when lockPort is called and the port is not connected, port.connect is called.

Returns:
(false,true) if autoConnect (is not, is) active.

exceptionListenerAdd

Status exceptionListenerAdd(User user,
                            ConnectExceptionListener connectExceptionListener)
Add a listener for connect/disconnect events. This can be called without owning the port.

Parameters:
user - The user.
connectExceptionListener - The listener interface.
Returns:
Status.success means that the attempt was successful. If the attempt fails user.getMessage() describes why the request failed.

exceptionListenerRemove

void exceptionListenerRemove(User user)
Remove a listener for connect/disconnect events. This can be called without owning the port.

Parameters:
user - The user.

scanQueues

void scanQueues()
Scan the queues. Can be called with or without owning the port.

connect

Status connect(User user)
Attempt to connect. This must be called with the port owned by the user.

Parameters:
user - The user.
Returns:
Status.success means that the attempt was successful. If the attempt fails user.getMessage() describes why the request failed.

disconnect

Status disconnect(User user)
Attempt to disconnect. This must be called with the port owned by the user.

Parameters:
user - The requester.
Returns:
Status.success means that the attempt was successful. If the attempt fails user.getMessage() describes why the request failed.

registerLockPortNotify

void registerLockPortNotify(LockPortNotify lockPortNotify)
Register to receive notice when lockPort, unLock port are called. This should only be called by a driver.

Parameters:
lockPortNotify - The notification interface.

unregisterLockPortNotify

void unregisterLockPortNotify()
Unregister to receive notice when lockPort, unLock port are called. Caller must call lockPort before calling this method.

createDevice

Device createDevice(DeviceDriver deviceDriver,
                    java.lang.String deviceName)
Called by driver to create a new device. Normally it is called as a result of a call to PortDriver.createDevice, which is called with the port locked. If it is called for some other reason than it must be called with the port locked.

Parameters:
deviceDriver - The deviceDriver interface.
deviceName - The deviceName.
Returns:
The deviceDriver interface or null if the driver can not create a device.

exceptionConnect

void exceptionConnect()
A connect exception. This is called by the portDriver. It is normally called as a result of Port calling portDriver.connect.

exceptionDisconnect

void exceptionDisconnect()
A disconnect exception.This is called by the portDriver. It is normally called as a result of Port calling portDriver.disconnect.
